net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class SimpleCommand

  • Object
    • AbstractCommand
      • SimpleCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class SimpleCommand
extends AbstractCommand
    A simple sub-class of the AbstractCommand abstract class that relies on lambda functions to implement the onOutput method and assumes that the command should always be executed and that the process generates an output in response to the command.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleCommand

        public SimpleCommand(String instruction,
                     BiPredicate<SimpleCommand,String> onStandardOutput,
                     BiPredicate<SimpleCommand,String> onErrorOutput)
        Constructs an instance according to the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        instruction - The instruction to write to the process' standard in.
        onStandardOutput - The predicate that allows for the processing of the process' standard output in response to the command and determines when the command is to be considered processed by returning true.
        onErrorOutput - The predicate that allows for the processing of the process' standard error output in response to the command and determines when the command is to be considered processed by returning true.

    • Method Detail

      • generatesOutput

        public boolean generatesOutput()
        Description copied from interface: Command
        A method called before the issuing of the instruction. It denotes whether the command is expected to generate output. If it returns false, the command is considered processed as soon as it is written to the process' standard in and therefore the process is considered ready for new commands right away. If it returns true, the Command.isProcessed(String, boolean) method determines when the command is deemed processed.
        Returns:
        Whether the executing process is expected to generate output in response to the command.

      • onOutput

        protected boolean onOutput(String outputLine,
                           boolean standard)
        Description copied from class: AbstractCommand
        It allows for the processing of the output and is responsible for determining whether the output line denotes the completion of the execution of the command.
        Specified by:
        onOutput in class AbstractCommand
        Parameters:
        outputLine - The new line of output printed to the standard out of the process.
        standard - Whether this line has been output to the standard out or to the standard error stream.
        Returns:
        Whether this line of output denotes that the process has finished processing the command.
